name: Dinner Tonight: Soy-Marinated Grilled Pork Tenderloin
description: My wife and I spent the last week moving across the country in a big yellow truck from Brooklyn to Bucktown, Chicago, and along the way we relied on the kindness of friends and relatives for meals and places to...

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the soy sauce, sugar, cumin, and garlic in a Ziploc bag or other marinating vessel. Rinse and dry the tenderloin and add to the bag. Allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Prepare coals or preheat a gas grill. Remove the meat from the marinade, reserving it. Grill the tenderloin over medium-high heat with the grill covered until cooked through, but still tender and juicy, turning occasionally, 7 to 10 minutes depending on thickness. Allow to rest for a couple minutes before slicing.
Roughly tear the top of the cilantro bunch, discarding the large stems, and scatter over a serving platter. Top with the cooked pork and serve.
